definition: to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: They made me repeat the whole story.
sentences.chinese: 全部情况从未公之于世。

sentences.english: In other words, they should realize their self-value by making their study analyzing, deducing, and meditating the certain problems public.
sentences.chinese: 然后将研究的结果，公之于世，以实现自我价值。

sentences.english: The opposition have demanded that all the facts should be made public.
sentences.chinese: 反对派要求把所有事实公之于世。

sentences.english: The full story was never made public.
sentences.chinese: 全部情况从未公之于世。

definition: to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know

to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
surviving manuscript/bequeathed draft (of book)
rarely known to anyone (idiom); almost unknown/secret to all but a few
to stash away/a hoard/a cache
to pass into oblivion
tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
manuscript/script
to compile
publication/a book's first appearance
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to send (a manuscript) to the press
